description.p: Gods of the Beauty Domain manifest in the lovely, charming and beautiful nature of the world, from the qualities of attractiveness to the profound beauty of the natural world. These Gods are patrons of bards, musicians, artists and all who dedicate themselves to instill beauty in the hearts of others, The clerics of gods of beauty excel in inspiring and influencing others to seek beauty in all its forms.
The Gods of Beauty and their clerics are patrons and masters of mead halls, brothels, taverns, conservatoires and inspire awe and joy wherever they are championing the pursuit of beauty itself.
When you choose this domain at lst leveL you gain proficiency in the Persuasion skilL Additionally, you gain proficiency with the Disguise kit and two musical instruments ofyour choice,

Beginning at 1st level, your inner and outer beauty makes you harder to hit. While you are wearing no armor, your AC equals 10 + your Wisdom modifier + your Charisma modifier, if you so choose. You can still use a shield and gain this benefit.
Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to take on a form so beautiful that mortal eyes cannot withstand.

As an action. you present your holy symbol, and each creature of your choice that can see you within 30 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be blinded until the end of your next turn. You can also cause any of the blinded creatures to drop what they are holding when they fail the saving throw.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, you can cause the inner beauty of a creature to spring forth, making it more persuasive and confident. When a creature within 30 feet that you can see makes a Charisma ability check or saving throw, you can use your reaction to add a +5 to the roll. You can do so after the creature rolls but before any effects of the roll occur. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a long rest.

description.p: Starting at 8th level, you add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.

sheet.description: You deal an additional {{wisdom:modifier}} hit points of damage with any cleric cantrip.

description.p: Starting at 17th level, you can transform into a vision of perfect beauty that mortal minds cannot withstand. Creatures failing a saving throw against your Blinding Beauty ability take 5d10 psychic damage and have their speed reduced to 0 until the end of your next turn. On a successful save, they take half as much damage and suffer no additional effects.
